thread.title: 50 years since statue of Christ submerged in Florida Keys
thread.title_full: 50 years since statue of Christ submerged in Florida Keys

title: 50 years since statue of Christ submerged in Florida Keys
text:
Sun and Sand 
Aug. 25 marks 50 years since a statue of Christ was submerged 5 miles off Key Largo in the Florida Keys. 
The 9-foot bronze "Christ of the Deep" statue rests in 25 feet of water in the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary. It's become a symbol for Key Largo's John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park, which is part of the sanctuary. 
The statue, a replica of a sculpture in Italy, is a tourist attraction for snorkelers, divers and passengers on glass-bottom boats who can see it from the surface. 
To mark the anniversary, the Amoray Dive Resort in Key Largo is sponsoring a contest with a prize of an underwater wedding at the statue and a stay at the resort for the best 100-word essay from a couple who would like to be married under the sea. Reader's comments Â»
